headlines.description: Arsenal ended their season with an emphatic 5-1 win over Everton but it wasn't enough to snap the final Champions League spot.
headlines.shortLinkText: Arsenal pipped by Spurs to Champions League

headlines.description: Jack Harrison's stoppage-time winner meant Leeds United ensured Premier League survival on Sunday with a 2-1 victory away at 10-man Brentford.
headlines.shortLinkText: Marsch masterminds Leeds' escape from drop

events.name: West Ham United at Brighton & Hove Albion

headlines.description: Brighton & Hove Albion came from behind to beat West Ham United 3-1 at the Amex Stadium on the final day of the Premier League season on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: West Ham to play in Conference League after loss

headlines.description: — Leeds survived in the Premier League for another season after Jack Harrison's injury-time goal sealed a tense 2-1 win over nine-man Brentford on Sunday, with Burnley relegated instead.
headlines.shortLinkText: Leeds ensures EPL survival with final-day win over Brentford

headlines.description: — Ross Barkley scored in injury time as Chelsea concluded a season of ownership turmoil with a 2-1 win over Watford in the final round of the Premier League on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Chelsea ends season of ownership turmoil with win vs Watford

headlines.description: Manchester United lost 1-0 to Crystal Palace on the final day of the Premier League as new coach Erik ten Hag watched on.
headlines.shortLinkText: Ten Hag watches Man Utd lose to Crystal Palace

headlines.description: — James Maddison scored again Sunday to help Leicester rout Southampton 4-1 in their final Premier League game of the season.
headlines.shortLinkText: Maddison scores again as Leicester routs Southampton 4-1

headlines.description: Liverpool came from a goal down to beat Wolverhampton Wanderers 3-1 on Sunday, but it was not enough to earn them their second Premier League title.
headlines.shortLinkText: Liverpool's Quadruple bid ends on epic final day

headlines.description: Manchester City won their fourth Premier League title in five years on Sunday after beating Aston Villa 3-2 at home on the final day of the season.
headlines.shortLinkText: Man City's stunning comeback seals title

headlines.description: Tottenham Hotspur have pipped Arsenal and qualified for the Champions League with a 5-0 victory over already-relegated Norwich City on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Spurs beat Norwich, pip Arsenal to UCL qual.
